newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish shares end sharply lower on U.S. jitters.
newsitem.headline: Swedish shares end sharply lower on U.S. jitters.

text.p: Swedish shares ended sharply lower on Tuesday, stung by recent U.S. weakness and climbing bond yields.
The exchange's general index dropped 4.34 percent to 2,631.23 in turnover of 4.87 billion crowns.
"It seems as if there was some selling from (bank) branches, while it has been quieter on the institutional side," a dealer said.
The downturn was broad and heavyweights drugs major Astra and telecoms group Ericsson were pulled along in the slump.
Astra plummeted 20 crowns to 344.5 and Ericsson dropped 12.5 crowns to 253.5.
Forestry group AssiDoman managed to withstand negative pressure and ended flat at 200 crowns.
"It is somewhat strange that AssiDoman withstood pressure so well, but it could be that people think it is well positioned in the economic cycle with its sawn timber," a trader said.
The bank sector dropped 4.21 percent with Nordbanken shedding eight crowns to land at 252 and S-E-Banken sliding 5.5 to 78.
